metadata.title: CVE-2019-2025 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In binder_thread_read of binder.c, there is a possible use-after-free dueto improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege inthe kernel with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: AndroidkernelAndroid ID: A-116855682References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2025` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1077.82
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1020-aws - 5.4.0-1020.20~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required
